intro: Mammillaria crinita, commonly known as the hairy mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly hairs. The plant typically produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
